result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taliyah N Jackson

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM  Defendant Taliyah N Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  SPD has yet to assign counsel in this case.  Court finds good cause to extend time  to conduct the hearing.  Prelim. is rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:45 AM  Defendant Taliyah Jackson appears via ZOOM.  Attorney Anthony Lambrecht appears via ZOOM for State of Wisconsin.  The PD's office has yet to appoint counsel in cases 22CF289 and 22CF290.  Defendant wishes to wait for appointment of counsel.  The Court finds good cause to extend time in which to conduct this hearing.  Preliminary hearing rescheduled.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

9:40 AM Defendant Taliyah N Jackson in court.  Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  PD's office has yet to appoint counsel in this matter.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits in which to conduct this hearing.  Defendant wishes to wait for a public defender.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

9:48 am - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taliyah N Jackson appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Public defender has not been able to appoint counsel yet.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-02-22 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

2:21 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taliyah N Jackson appeared by video. Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 07-25-22 at 1:30 pm. Br. 1.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:30 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taliyah N Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing.  More time needed to appoint counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:55 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taliyah N Jackson in court.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing in court with the defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance is reset to 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 03-24-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
--Dajanelle Jackson, 965 S. 35th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of theft by virtue of employment, misdemeanor bail jumping and felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Taco Bell in Manitowoc, WI  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 03-28-2022
